keyEvents.title: Aftermath of Tiger's Attack Discussed
keyEvents.description: King Neptune discusses the political fallout from Fisher Tiger's attack on Mary Geoise and liberation of slaves, noting it will prevent Fish-Man Island from attending the World Summit.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the far-reaching political consequences of Tiger's actions and the World Government's response.

reveals.information: Fisher Tiger's attack on Mary Geoise has caused Fish-Man Island to be barred from the World Summit

description: The holy land of the World Government, located at the top of the Red Line. Home to the Celestial Dragons and location of the World Summit.
significance: Mary Geoise represents the seat of power for the World Government and the Celestial Dragons, making Fisher Tiger's successful attack and slave liberation all the more remarkable and politically significant.

keyEvents.title: Celebration of Tiger as Hero
keyEvents.description: The citizens of Fish-Man Island celebrate Fisher Tiger as a hero for his attack on Mary Geoise and liberation of slaves, while Queen Otohime's attempts to gather signatures for peaceful human migration are rejected.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the divide in Fish-Man Island society between those who support violent rebellion against humans and those who seek peaceful coexistence.

reveals.information: The population largely celebrates Tiger's violent actions against the World Government while rejecting Otohime's peaceful approach

description: An underwater kingdom inhabited by fish-men and merfolk, located beneath the ocean on the way to the New World.
significance: Fish-Man Island serves as the homeland for the fish-men and the backdrop for exploring themes of discrimination, racism, and different approaches to achieving equality.
